modulesynopsis.name: mod_allowhandlers
modulesynopsis.description: Easily restrict what HTTP handlers can be used on the server

summary.p: This module makes it easy to restrict which handlers may be used for a request. A possible configuration would be:
summary.highlight: <Location /> AllowHandlers not server-info server-status balancer-manager ldap-status </Location>
summary.p: It also registers a handler named forbidden that simply returns 403 FORBIDDEN to the client. This can be used with directives like AddHandler.

directivesynopsis.name: AllowHandlers
directivesynopsis.description: Restrict access to the listed handlers

usage.p: The handler names are case sensitive. The special name none can be used to match the case where no handler has been set. The special vallue all can be used to allow all handlers again in a later config section, even if some headers were denied earlier in the configuration merge order:
